factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure & high conformational flexibility, solvent accessibility, carboxylate buffers: phosphate, bicarbonate, tris
comments: Deamidation rate strongly depends on the i+1 residue: very high risk for NG; high risk for NH, NS, NT, NA; lower risk for bulky and hydrophobic residues (e.g. NI, NV, NL, NW, NP, etc.)
references: N. e. Robinson et al. 2004; N. E. Robinson and Robinson 2004; Wakankar and Borchardt 2006

factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure & high conformational flexibility, solvent accessibility, carboxylate buffers: phosphate, bicarbonate, tris
comments: Deamidation rate strongly depends on the i+1 residue: high risk for QG; medium risk for QC; low risk for bulky and acidic residues (e.g. QW, QF, QD, QE, QP, etc.)
references: N. e. Robinson et al. 2004; N. E. Robinson and Robinson 2004; Wakankar and Borchardt 2006

factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure & high conformational flexibility, solvent accessibility, carboxylate buffers: phosphate, bicarbonate, addition of glycerol, sucrose
references: Geiger and Clarke 1987; Wakankar and Borchardt 2006

factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure & high conformational flexibility, solvent accessibility
references: Cloos and Christgau 2002

factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure & high conformational flexibility, solvent accessibility
references: Cloos and Christgau 2002

factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure & high conformational flexibility, high solvent accessibility
comments: Hydrolysis rate of DP motif is 8-10 times higher than the rest.
references: Lauer et al. 2016; Vlasak and Ionescu 2011

liability: Backbone hydrolysis near Ser & racemization of Ser
references: Lyons, Jamie, and Truscott 2011, 2014; Wezynfeld, Frączyk, and Bal 2016
Lyons, Jamie, and Truscott 2011, 2014; Wezynfeld, Frączyk, and Bal 2016

liability: Backbone hydrolysis between sequence positions 2 and 3 via diketopiperazine formation
factors_disfavoring_stability: Polar or charged amino acids in the 1st position, alkylammonium carboxylates
references: Capasso and Mazzarella 1999; Goolcharran and Borchardt 1998; Zhang, Hales, and Clemmer 2022
Bersin, Patel, and Topp 2021; Chelius et al. 2006

factors_disfavoring_stability: light, oxygen, transition metal ions

factors_favoring_stability: pH significantly lower than apparent pKa of Tyr (ca. 10.0)

factors_favoring_stability: pH significantly lower than apparent pKa of Cys (ca. 8.3)

factors_disfavoring_stability: Oxygen, solvent exposure & degree of hydration, metal ions

factors_disfavoring_stability: Proximity to and accessibility by thiols (e.g. Cys), alkaline pH
